attributes.comment:
I take issue with the fee increases accross the board. With no gurantee of
better service, what good will higher fees do? Just this past week, after
following the instructions on the CIS website exactly, my I-600A was returned
because I paid with a personal check. Despite the CIS website saying personal
checks were acceptable, our local office no longer accepts them. The
inconsistency from office to office is astounding. Some allow your biometrics
to be done before your application is complete, some don't. Some take weeks,
some take months and months.

My biggest issue, however, is the proposed increase in the N-600, application
for the Certificate of Citizenship. Under the Child Citizenship Act of 2000, my
child automatically became a US Citizen. However, I still have to pay for a
certificate to prove it? The fee is nearly doubling for a piece of paper that
families are waiting up to a year for and often have to drag their young child
to an interview with a CIS official. All children who enter the US on IR-3
Visas receive this document automatically in the mail at no additional cost. If
CIS wants to save money, why not do the same for children who enter on IR-4
visas after proof of full and final adoption is supplied?
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Nicole McDonald
